head: In the last two general election cycles, poll officials publicly announced and posted official results across Nigeria. At many polling units only one party had an agent present to witness the 2011 process, while this figure improved significantly in 2015.
sub: [motion graphic of to generic party agents looking at each other then at a sign for a polling unit.]
[interactive map of polling units  in 2011 and 2015 with only one party agent present]
[video on political party presence featuring: Importance of presence at polling units Presence in 2011 Presence in 2015 Low disagreement with results]

head: Although parties and their candidates sometimes dispute outcomes, the PVT shows how party agents are spread across the territory and that they tend to agree with the results.
sub: [map of party agent presence across the country and losing partyâ€™s (between PDP and APC) presence at polling units + acceptance of results]

head: Should parties deploy their agents similarly to 2015 in 2019, they will be well positioned to know polling unit results and thus the outcome themselves.
